conclusion: Mass of block A and B are both m, spring constant is k, force applied is F upward.
The system is initially at rest with block B in contact with the ground.
Objective is to find the initial acceleration of block A when force F is applied.
Initially, the spring force balances the weight of block A: F_spring = m_A g.
A force F is applied upward on block A.
Net force on block A is determined by considering upward force F and downward forces m_A g and F_spring.
Net force on block A: F_net = F - m_A g - F_spring.
Since F_spring = m_A g, F_net = F - 2m_A g.
Using Newton's second law, F_net = m_A a, derive a = (F - 2m_A g) / m_A.
The initial acceleration a of block A is a = F/m_A - 2g.
